resources.string: Height is expressed in meters so if you measure 170 cm you should express it as 1.70, mass is expressed in kilograms,

The body mass index (BMI) is a mathematical ratio that associates the mass and height of an individual, devised by the Belgian statistician Adolphe Quetelet, which is why it is also known as the Quetelet index.

Anthropometric indicators are values ​​of dimension and body composition that offer useful information for the evaluation of the risk of disease cardiovascular disease (CVD), due to excess fat and its distribution.
Body composition refers to the amount of fat you have, compared to muscle mass (muscles, bones, "body water", organs, etc.).
